Jon Hanna <jon@...> writes:

> hovhannes_tumanyan wrote:

> prices, availability etc. The important distinction, I believe, that
>> server side data does not change in the course of normal operation.
>
> PUT, POST and DELETE are in HTTP for a reason.


hovhannes_tumanyan,

I think if you can accept that the state of server-side resources can
change, the whole picture becomes clearer.

To elucidate on Jon Hanna's reply, the change should be caused by
POST, PUT or DELETE (if you are using HTTP anyway) and never by GET.

YS.
